answers.answer: a couple of the ladies here on the february babies forum have been experiencing knee, hip and mostly joint pain from what i have been able to follow... but i dont think anyone is expeciencing anything extreme as heart problems... i do have a friend that developed diabetes post partum, even though she didnt have gestational diabetes... so i guess anything is possible your body changes so much i am not surprised, hope you start feeling better soon!!
I got IBS.  Haven't been right since labor.  My mother thinks I have colon cancer.  I think it is just my system all messed up.
This is a great post because yes there are women out there that have developed some unusual health problems after pregnancy.  Glad you started the thread.  Hope to see more people share on here.

I can't say I got heart problems, but I did get IBS, Gastritis and GERD. Prior to giving birth I had minor acid reflux when I ate fast food, but nothing to this extent. I'm on PPI's for the rest of my life, as well as carefully watching my diet.
I developed hypothyroidism after having my little one.  I have always had migraines but they are much more intense to the point of vision loss, but that could be from hormones.
Do you have Hashimoto's? Did you go through a hyper thyroid phase before becoming hypo? Did you ever have your antibodies checked? How are you treating your hypothyroid?

I wanted to add I actually had an issue with migraines prior to motherhood and then after birth my migraines almost ceased and my periods were a lot less worse than what they were.  I still do get a headache right before I am about to start my cycle but it is not hardly as debilitating as they used to be.  Great to read all of the posts on this.

I'm not sure what hashimoto's is, so I'm gonna say no.  I did not go through a hyper phase only hypo.  But I haven't had any symptoms other than fatigue but come on I have a newborn, I can't blame my thyroid for that.  I'm not sure if my antibodies were tested, I had normal prenatal tests.  I'm currently on synthroid but i'm being over medicated every six weeks i get bloodwork and they drop my dose again.  I went from 100mcg to 88 and now 75, so hopefully my thyroid problem is reversing.

Yes wanabb, what mother does not encounter fatigue after birth.  I swear it takes me about a good 6 weeks to just get my hormones regulated again and to start to get back some of my energy from birth.  Keep us posted on your thyroid.

question: Not sure if this is the correct place to post. Do any if you new mothers have health problems since giving birth that you didn't have before? I have Hashimoto's Disease and also might have a heart abnormality. ER doctor I saw for heart palpitations said sometimes after giving birth you can develop problems you didn't have before. Just curious if anyone else has experienced something like that.
